III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/20/25, a staff member and a youth were having a
conversation about contraband and the staff member slapped the
youth and began yelling at the youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 03/21/2025 and
they reported no additional information.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 03/21/2025. JJ
Worker reported she met with Youth A today, 3/21/2025 and
Youth A kept going back and forth about staff slapping him. She
said initially Youth A reported Staff 1 slapped him, but later he
recanted and said it was by accident and not intentional. JJ
Worker tried to get more information, but Youth A kept changing
his story. She said Youth A has been doing well at the facility and
is in the process of completing the program. Youth A should be
discharged and released back home in a few weeks. She had no
concerns for the facility or staff.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 03/21/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 1. Youth A reported feeling
safe and did not express any concerns regarding staff. Youth A
denied having any bruises or injuries.
Youth A was interviewed a second time, at the facility on
03/26/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Youth A has
been at the facility for one year and three months and is placed on
pod H. He reported on 03/20/2025 they had a group meeting and
afterwards, Staff 1 and Staff 2 were getting ready to leave the pod.
He followed Staff 1 and Staff 2 to the exit door to ask a question
about his level. He said Youth B was also at the exit door standing
behind Staff 1, as he approached Staff 1, he saw Youth B slap
Staff 1 on the back of her head. Staff 1 turned around and saw
Youth A standing behind her, so she turned around and slapped
2

Youth A. He was shocked that Staff 1 slapped him, although he
did not get hurt and it was not a hard slap. He said Staff 1 thought
he was the one that slapped her on the head, because Youth B
walked away after he hit Staff 1 on the head. Youth A denied
getting hurt or needing medical attention. Youth A denied any
previous incidents with Staff 1 or any other staff at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Youth B has been at the
facility for nine months and is placed on Pod H. Youth B recalled
that he was standing at the exit door with Staff 1 and Staff 2 on
03/20/2025. Youth B admitted on 03/20/2025 he tapped Staff 1 on
the back on the head when she was trying to exit the pod. Youth B
said he was just playing around with Staff 1. Youth B said he
walked away from the door and did not witness or hear Staff 1
slap Youth A. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility and
denied any concern regarding Staff 1 or any other staff.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Youth C has been at the
facility for seven months and is placed on Pod H. Youth C denied
witnessing Staff 1 slap Youth A. Youth C reported that Youth A
told him that Staff 1 slapped him when they were standing by the
exit door, however he did not see Staff 1 slap Youth A. Youth C
did witness Youth A hit the plate out of Staff 1’s hand. Youth C
said Youth A tends to get very close in a person’s personal space
when talking. Youth C said Youth A does that to him all the time.
Youth C reported no concerns regarding Staff 1 or any other staff
at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Staff 1 has been working at
the facility for two years and denied any discipline. Staff 1 denied
slapping Youth A 03/20/25. She said on 03/20/25 after the group
meeting, she and Staff 2 were leaving the pod because their shift
ended, Youth B followed them to the exit door trying to talk to
them about what was discussed in the group meeting. Youth B
was directed to move away from the exit door, and that’s when
Youth A and Youth C also walked up to the exit door. The three
youth were directed to move away from the exit door, so Staff 1
and Staff 2 could exit the pod. Youth B got mad and hit Staff 1 on
the back of the head, Staff 1 turned around and Youth A was
standing directly behind her. When Staff 1 turned around her hand
was up and it bumped his hand, which indirectly hit Youth A’s
face. She said Youth A was very agitated, she was holding a
food plate and Youth A slapped the plate out of her hand. She
3

denied saying anything to Youth A or purposely hitting Youth A’s
hand. Staff 1 adamantly denied hitting or slapping Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Has been working at the
facility for two months and had completed all new hire training
including MANDT verbal and physical de-escalation training. Staff
recalled the incident on 03/20/2025, she and Staff 1 were getting
ready to exit Pod H after the group meeting, Youth B followed
them to the exit door, Youth B was directed to move away from
the exit door, then Youth A and Youth C approached the exit door.
Youth A was gesturing with his hands as he was talking, Youth B
then hit Staff 1 on the back of the head and walked away. Staff 1
turned around to see who hit her on the back of the head, Staff 1’s
hand bumped Youth A’s hand, and Youth A’s hand his hit own
face. Staff 1 was holding a plate in one hand and her hand was
up. Youth A got very upset and started yelling at Staff. Staff 2
denied Staff 1 slapped or said anything to upset Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Staff 3 has been working at
the facility for one year. Staff 3 was working on 03/20/2025 on Pod
H. Staff 3 denied witnessing Staff 1 slap Youth A on 03/20/2025.
Staff 3 reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C followed Staff 1
and Staff 2 as they were exiting the pod on 03/20/2025. She
witnessed Youth A standing directly behind Staff 1 and when Staff
1 turned around after Youth C bumped her on the head, Staff 1’s
hand hit Youth A’s hand and Youth A’s hand hit his face. She said
Youth A was irritated and started to yell at Staff 1. She denied
witnessing Staff 1 push or slap Youth A. Afterwards Youth A
asked to speak to manager and reported that Staff 1 slapped him.
She said Youth A did not report being injured or hurt.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Administrator reported Staff
1 has been employed at the facility for 18 months and has no
disciplinary actions. He said all staff completed the MANDT verbal
and physical de-escalation last month. Staff 1 has been moved to
a different pod pending the investigation.
Director was interviewed at the facility on 03/26/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist 2. Director reported she spoke
with Youth A after he calmed down on 03/20/2025, Youth A
changed his story and claimed he was not sure if Staff 1 had hit
4

him, but thinks it was by accident. She said Youth A is very
pleasant and usually well behaved. Youth A has completed the
program and is expected to be discharged in the next two weeks.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 03/20/2025 was reviewed (note: video has no
audio). Youth A, Youth B and Youth C are observed sitting in a
circle, one staff sitting with the youths, and two other staff
standing. The circle breaks up and two staff (Staff 1 and Staff 2)
start walking to the exit door. Youth B follows the two female staff
to the exit door. Youth A and Youth C also approach the exit door.
Youth C and staff appear to be having a conversation. Youth A
and Youth B join in the conversation with the three staff members
standing by the door. Youth C is standing behind Staff 1, reaches
over and hits her on the back of the head and walks away. Youth
A appears to be agitated and pushes something out of Staff 1’s
hand. It’s difficult to see the exchange between Youth A and Staff
1 due to the number of people by the door, however Staff 1 does
exit the pod after Youth A pushes something out of her hand.
Documents Reviewed:
• Unusual incident report dated 03/20/2025, written by
Manager 1. Youth A provided a written statement stating on
03/20/25, Staff 1 slapped him because Staff 1 said he hit
her on the back of her head.
• Youth Discipline & Behavior Modification Policy states that
any type of physical discipline is prohibited. The use of
verbal and non-physical crisis intervention should be
utilized first and may prevent the need for physical
intervention. A youth initiating physical contact with a staff
or another person with the intent of controlling or harming
that person and/or picks up something to use as a weapon
is considered a physical assault. The appropriate staff
response is to use a safe physical management procedure
to control the youth and then use the Behavior
Management Procedure until the youth is under physical
and emotional control.
• Staff 1 has no disciplinary record. Staff 1 completed
MANDT verbal de-escalation on 02/20/2025 and MANDT
physical skills training on 03/06/2025.
Analysis The facility is complaint with the rule based on interviews
conducted and video footage reviewed there is insufficient
evidence to support the allegations that staff slapped youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
